edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData
Class OntEntry

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.RationaleElement
      edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.OntEntry
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class OntEntry
extends RationaleElement
implements java.io.Serializable

This defines the contents of an element in the Argument Ontology. Ontology entries are typically types of non-functional requirements (like scalability and security).

Author:
burgeje
See Also:

serialVersionUID

See Also:
Constant Field Values

nRefs

int nRefs
How many other elements refer to this entry

importance

Importance importance
How important is this entry (NFR)

level

int level
What level in the hierarchy is this element? An item can be in multiple places so the level ends up being the level of the last place it was added... probably not what we want!

parents

java.util.Vector<OntEntry> parents
Our parent items. The tree works like a doubly-linked list where children and parents point to each other

children

java.util.Vector<OntEntry> children
Our child entries (those lower than us in the hierarchy)

m_eventGenerator

private RationaleElementUpdateEventGenerator<OntEntry> m_eventGenerator

inDatabase

private boolean inDatabase()
Check if our element is already in the database. The check is different if you are reading it in from XML because you can do a query on the name. Otherwise you can't because you run the risk of the user having changed the name.

Returns:
true if in the database already
